mainFeatures: Written in Rust for memory safety and performance

marketPositioning: Burn positions itself as a 'next generation' deep learning framework built in Rust, emphasizing flexibility, efficiency, and portability without compromise. It targets developers seeking alternatives to established Python-based frameworks like TensorFlow and PyTorch, particularly those who value performance, memory safety (inherent in Rust), and the ability to deploy models across a wide spectrum of devices, from embedded systems to large GPU clusters. Its focus on a backend-agnostic architecture, automatic kernel fusion, and simplified deployment workflow differentiates it, aiming to provide a more unified and performant experience across diverse hardware.
